attributes.action: Make government provide free voting ID cards for voters as many can,t afford it
attributes.background: if UK government require two forms of photo ID for vote. Please understand low paid workers and esa and job seekers won't have income to pay £72+ for passport and £34 for provisional driving ID. JSA is 73.50 or less after rent bedroom tax and council tax. Charging will exclude many from vote.

rejection.details:
At the moment, there is no requirement for people to show two forms of ID to vote.

The Government is planning a pilot of asking voters to show ID before they vote. You can find out more about this here:

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/voter-id-pilot-to-launch-in-local-elections

The form of identification to be used will be set by the councils, not the Government, but the pilot will involve trialling both photo ID and non-photo ID.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
